Course Councils

Course councils are responsible for the continuous evaluation and improvement of integrated curriculum used for online and campus courses.  Each council is lead by a course lead assigned by the departments to ensure departmental stewardship for online courses.  When an improvement has been identified by the council it is then submitted to the course improvement coordinator for an online quality standards review conducted by the assigned curriculum development manager.

Membership

The course lead (department assigned) and online course lead (assigned by online instruction) are always members of the council.  If the course has a campus teaching group leader the department might also want to add that individual to the council.  The course council may also coordinate delivery options of a course to insure an integrated curriculum for campus, online, hybrid, and/or compentency based versions of the course.  Other members from on or off campus can be added by the department.  The course lead can make membership decisions if that authority is delegated by the department chair.
